note: Global anomalies have been determined by dividing the world into a grid, averaging the data for each cell of the grid, and then averaging the grid cells together.
title: Global precipitation anomaly
subtitle: This indicator shows annual anomalies compared with the average precipitation from 1901 to 2000 based on rainfall and snowfall measurements from land-based weather stations worldwide.
sourceDesc: National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) via the US EPA
